creator: nop.lists@gmail.com
text:
Loading jtl files created recently with JMeter 2.1.1 into the aggregate report
does not always work.

The error has several forms:

Form1: 
- the information is being loaded only partially.
- an error message saying "Error loading result file - see log file" appears
(see screenshot).
- in the jmeter.log the message "2005/11/14 16:06:29 WARN  -
jmeter.reporters.ResultCollector: File load failure, trying old data format. "
appears.


Form2: 
- the raw information is being loaded fully but the calculations are wrong
(comparing with scrrenshots I had made when the tests were done).
- an error message saying "Error loading result file - see log file" appears
(see screenshot).
- in the jmeter.log the message "2005/11/14 16:06:29 WARN  -
jmeter.reporters.ResultCollector: File load failure, trying old data format. "
appears.

Form3: 
Sometimes JMeter aborts with a "[GCException java.lang.OutOfMemoryError:
requested 24 bytes" message.
Please note that the JTL files are not THAT big and enough space is available...

Created attachment 16966
Screenshot showing the error message in the aggregate report
creator: nop.lists@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 16967
one failing JTL file
creator: nop.lists@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Seems to be a problem with handling the end of the file. It reads in all the 
records, and then fails. I'll look at this later.

Meanwhile. try setting the output format to 2.1 in jmeter.properties

file_format.testlog=2.1

and see if this works better.

creator: nop.lists@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> Seems to be a problem with handling the end of the file. It reads in all the 
> records, and then fails. I'll look at this later.
Well, sometimes it fails even before reading the whole file.

> Meanwhile. try setting the output format to 2.1 in jmeter.properties
> file_format.testlog=2.1
> and see if this works better.
No, JMeter crashed again with the error message:
[GCException java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 1574848 bytes

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Found the problem with the "error loading file" message - ResultCollector was 
failing to set success even if it had loaded the old XML format correctly, and 
so was generating the error message.

Perhaps this is also causing the calculations to be mangled. I'll create a new 
nightly build a bit later.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
I've just created nightly build jakarta-jmeter-2-1.20051115

Would you be able to try this?

It should fix error Form1.

It's unlikely to fix all the errors, so please attach further files as needed.

By the way, please ensure Zip files are flagged as binary.
